body_html:
whatever you managed to do doesnt seem to want to work for me

the result of running "pip --version" was
"pip 7.1.2 from /Users/act65/anaconda/lib/python3.4/site-packages (python 3.4)"

i dont get any errors when reinstalling pip
running
"$ pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/tensorflow-0.5.0-py2-none-any.whl"
i get the same error, not a supported wheel...
i tried running sudo pip ... and got
"The directory '/Users/act65/Library/Caches/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag."

I have tried a few different things but now have run out of ideas, I tried using docker instead and I think it worked, but how do i get the docker environment over into anaconda and thus sypder, my IDE???

I also tried using the virtualenv thing, but that doesnt work either -
i run
"$ virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/tensorflow)
and get
"ERROR: The executable /Users/act65/tensorflow/bin/python3 is not functioning
ERROR: It thinks sys.prefix is '/Users/act65' (should be '/Users/act65/tensorflow')
ERROR: virtualenv is not compatible with this system or executable"
body_text:
whatever you managed to do doesnt seem to want to work for me
the result of running "pip --version" was
"pip 7.1.2 from /Users/act65/anaconda/lib/python3.4/site-packages (python 3.4)"
i dont get any errors when reinstalling pip
running
"$ pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/tensorflow-0.5.0-py2-none-any.whl"
i get the same error, not a supported wheel...
i tried running sudo pip ... and got
"The directory '/Users/act65/Library/Caches/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag."
I have tried a few different things but now have run out of ideas, I tried using docker instead and I think it worked, but how do i get the docker environment over into anaconda and thus sypder, my IDE???
I also tried using the virtualenv thing, but that doesnt work either -
i run
"$ virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/tensorflow)
and get
"ERROR: The executable /Users/act65/tensorflow/bin/python3 is not functioning
ERROR: It thinks sys.prefix is '/Users/act65' (should be '/Users/act65/tensorflow')
ERROR: virtualenv is not compatible with this system or executable"
body:
whatever you managed to do doesnt seem to want to work for me

the result of running "pip --version" was 
"pip 7.1.2 from /Users/act65/anaconda/lib/python3.4/site-packages (python 3.4)"

i dont get any errors when reinstalling pip
running 
"$ pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/tensorflow-0.5.0-py2-none-any.whl"
i get the same error, not a supported wheel...
i tried running sudo pip ... and got
"The directory '/Users/act65/Library/Caches/pip/http' or its parent directory is not owned by the current user and the cache has been disabled. Please check the permissions and owner of that directory. If executing pip with sudo, you may want sudo's -H flag."

I have tried a few different things but now have run out of ideas, I tried using docker instead and I think it worked, but how do i get the docker environment over into anaconda and thus sypder, my IDE???

I also tried using the virtualenv thing, but that doesnt work either - 
i run 
"$ virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/tensorflow)
and get
"ERROR: The executable /Users/act65/tensorflow/bin/python3 is not functioning
ERROR: It thinks sys.prefix is '/Users/act65' (should be '/Users/act65/tensorflow')
ERROR: virtualenv is not compatible with this system or executable"
